title: Add continuous notification
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi
I love this open source app and using it quite often. But sometimes my phone is in my pocket and I'm listening to music and I miss the time ended notification ! The vibration is short, easy to miss, same thing for the notifications sounds. I'd find "logical" to have a continuous notification that vibrates and rings until I manually stop it (from notification bar or inside app).
Is this feature planned for a future release ? 
Thanks

title: Bug found in hourglass when continuous ring is enabled
body:

Download the app from fdroid. 2. Launch the app. 3. Click on the recycle icon in the left side of the bottom part of the screen that is next to "about" 4. Click on the bottom part of upper section of the hourglass image. 5. Wait stops the ring stops. The application closes and crashed * Browser: hourglass app version 1.6 * Operating system: android 6.0 infinix Note 3 #### Recording Of The Bug I used 3 different screen recorder but they all fail to capture the crash message. https://youtu.be/rDRse4liroE So I captured the screen shot too. ![Screenshot_20180328-215709.png](https://cdn.utopian.io/posts/c9af9c67de06f9ff2397adfa551fff401077Screenshot_20180328-215709.png)

title: improve manual time entry
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Thanks for hourglass. I use the manual time entry a lot (I use it to time student group discussions). I believe it could be made much easier to use:
1) when I enter the textfield, the cursor is positioned somewhere. It would be nice to either preselect all minutes or all seconds, depending on where I put the focus.
2) By default, all minutes should be selected, so that I can just start typing the number of minutes I need (and ideally pop up the keyboard automatically as well.
3) When I delete everything and just enter 10, hourglass returns to the main screen, ignoring my entry. It should recognize 10 as 10:00.
